If there is any final step or specific information you need from me to be considered once/if the place is released from hold, please let me know and I will send it right away.

Kind regards,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_C remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (ranked 4th). Repeated rejections suggest Nursery_C is holding out for higher-priority families, but with time passing and the nursery still unmatched, the best move is to submit a concise formal application again, emphasizing immediate acceptance and full flexibility, and asking if any additional step would help convert the hold into an offer.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your continued interest in Nursery_C and for confirming you can accept immediately with full flexibility.

We are able to offer you the available place at Nursery_C. Please reply to confirm acceptance, and we will send the enrollment paperwork and next steps (start date confirmation and required documents) the same day.

Kind regards,
Nursery_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_C has quota 1 and remains unmatched. True priority is A > B > C > D > E, so Parent_E is lowest. However, by round 15 no higher-priority parent (A, B, D) has applied to Nursery_C, and Parent_C already applied and was rejected earlier. Continuing to hold out risks ending unmatched by round 30. Since Parent_E is willing to accept immediately and is flexible, accepting now secures a match rather than risking an empty seat. No other applicants are in the inbox this round.
